attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/fassikafikre|@fassikafikre>: We have 3D printed face shield to give out to frontline health workers in #Ethiopia. Our aim is to donate a few to health workers to test it and give feedback on improvements. Then we'll rally up 3D printer owners here and produce as many as possible to donate <https://twitter.com/FMoHealth|@FMoHealth>.(1/2) <https://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1243197947485052938/pu/img/XX6q8_OgfguhFDfh.jpg>

attachments.fallback:
[March 26th, 2020 10:56 PM] amenbelayneh: Hi, I came across <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BoDwXwZXsDI&list=WL&index=3> which introduced to how the Czechs reached a point were it become compulsory  *to wear something covering a part of your mouth and nose when leaving your residence*.  Links from the video description <https://tiny.cc/masks4all> (Czech story) and,  <http://tiny.cc/maskswork> (research papers and summaries on the benefits of masks)

I understand we would want the little masks we have to be available for the health professionals, as such asking the population to refrain from using masks is a valid request. Then the question is can we do what the Czechs did? I doubt we will be able to, because we might not have enough tools and input materials for making it happen. Even if we did, it might take weeks to reach the level of production that is helpful, or we might want these masks to be first available to the individuals at high risk of contracting the virus and who's services are of utmost importance , for example,  Health Extension Workers, firefighters, police officers and other service providers. I am not saying it is impossible just the cost in time might be too high.

But, I think we have one cultural advantage, Natela (ነጠላ). The advantage I see are,
1. significant number of the population have it. Thus, financial cost will not be a hindrance for most,
2. adaptation of its use can be achieved rapidly. Thus, it doesn't have much cost in time,
3. Similar communication as used by the Czechs government can be used *"covering a part of your mouth and nose when leaving your residence"* instead of "wear masks". Thus, it doesn't conflict with existing messaging of not using masks unless you are sick.

A possible disadvantage of using Natela (ነጠላ) is its various form factors. Describing how many time to fold before wearing might differ depending on the different thicknesses. But I am not a marketer, or professional health communicator, so it might not be a big issue.

What do you think?

Then the question is can we do what the Czechs did? I doubt we will be able to, because we might not have enough tools and input materials for making it happen. Even if we did, it might take weeks to reach the level of production that is helpful, or we might want these masks to be first available to the individuals at high risk of contracting the virus and who's services are of utmost importance , for example,  Health Extension Workers, firefighters, police officers and other service providers. I am not saying it is impossible just the cost in time might be too high.

But, I think we have one cultural advantage, Natela (ነጠላ). The advantage I see are,
1. significant number of the population have it. Thus, financial cost will not be a hindrance for most,

A possible disadvantage of using Natela (ነጠላ) is its various form factors. Describing how many time to fold before wearing might differ depending on the different thicknesses. But I am not a marketer, or professional health communicator, so it might not be a big issue.

attachments.title: OVERVIEW: Czech campaign #masks4all
attachments.text: During the COVID-19 crisis, the Czech Republic has experienced shortages of protective equipment (masks and respirators).
